title: How Many Calories in a Chipotle Burrito?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a burrito from Chipotle, including macros, sodium, and tweaks for custom builds—based on a standard chicken option.
h1: How Many Calories in a Chipotle Burrito?
assumptions: Standard chicken burrito with white rice, black beans, fajita veggies, mild tomato salsa, cheese, sour cream, and lettuce; flour tortilla; approximate Chipotle values.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by customizations, portion sizes, and exact ingredients at Chipotle. Use their nutrition calculator for precision; check in-store info.

quick_answer.text: A typical Chipotle chicken burrito contains about 1025 calories with 48g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with Chipotle's info.

faqs.q: How many calories in a Chipotle burrito with chicken?
faqs.a: Approximately 1025 calories for a standard build with rice, beans, and toppings.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a burrito from Chipotle?
faqs.a: About 48g protein in a chicken burrito.

faqs.q: Are Chipotle burritos high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 2125mg sodium due to seasonings and beans—watch if on a low-sodium diet.

faqs.q: How to lower calories in a Chipotle burrito?
faqs.a: Skip cheese, sour cream, and rice; opt for bowl instead of tortilla to save ~300 kcal.

faqs.q: Calories in a veggie burrito from Chipotle?
faqs.a: Roughly 900-1000 kcal, depending on add-ons like guac or extra rice.
